editionStmt.funder: Conversion of the printed catalogue to TEI funded by the Thompson Family Charitable Trust

msDesc.head: Jacobus de Voragine, selected saints’ lives

supportDesc.extent:
Fols. viii (numbered fols. i–iii, 1–5) + 196 (numbered fols. 6–201) + iii (numbered fols. iv–vi).
155 105

layoutDesc.layout: Writing area variable, approximately 120–5 90 . In long lines, about 32 lines to the page. Infrequent prickings; bounded and ruled in lead and brown ink.

binding.p: A modern replacement. Sewn on four thongs. At the front, a marbled paper leaf (dated ‘1907’ on the verso) and two modern paper flyleaves; at the rear, two modern paper flyleaves and another marbled paper leaf (iv–vi).

history.provenance: ‘Liber Fratris [erased] in quo continentur hec’, heading a contents table for the whole, numbered to 39 items (four added) (fol. 4v).

Ex prouisione Fratris Thome Russel Liber Monasterij sancti Martini de Bello Qui dicitur traditio patrum cum alijs [BVRG added at the end of the line] Et dicit liber iste tractatus Thome de aquino’ (fol. 4, s. xv), a reference to item 26 (?) (Ker, MLGB 8, 229).

‘Caleb Burdett possidet me’ (fol. 3, s. xvi in., beneath an erased ownership inscription). This would suggest that the volume, like others from Burdett, was part of John Stonor’s donation, although that is not noted in either the MS or the Benefactors’ Book.

source.bibl: Ralph Hanna, A descriptive catalogue of the western medieval manuscripts of St. John's College, Oxford (Oxford: Oxford University Press, 2002) (with additional folio references added in the transcription of item 26 for clarity)

availability.p: For enquiries relating to this manuscript please contact St John's College Library.

Ker, N. R., Medieval Libraries of Great Britain: A List of Surviving Books. Royal Historical Society Guides and Handbooks. 2nd edn. (London, 1964), extended by Andrew G. Watson, MLGB: Supplement to the Second Edition. RHS Guides and Handbooks 15 (1987).

Schmidt, Paul Gerhardt, ‘Der Rangstreit zwischen Mann und Frau im lateinischen Mittelalter’, in G. J. Reinink and H. L. J. Vanstiphout (eds.), Dispute Poems and Dialogues in the Ancient and Medieval Near East (Louvain, 1991), 213–36.

Walther, Hans, Initia carminum ac versuum Medii Aevi posterioris Latinorum, 2nd edn (Göttingen, 1969).

altIdentifier.idno: An Added Quire of Front Matter = Fols. 1–5

msItem.incipit: Ostensio quod tota gloria in palacio Vado mori rex sum quid honor quid gloria mundi | Est via mors hominis
msItem.explicit: hic mihi vado mori | Est commune mori mors nulli parat honori
msItem.note: Cf. Walther, no. 19965. Fols. 1–2 include five different texts, four in different textura hands (one responsible for items a–b), s. xiii.

msItem.incipit: Hec documenta tene si uis urbanus haberi | Non lotis manibus escam non sumpseris vnquam | Atque locum tene
msItem.explicit: potum superaddere noli | Quid sociis noceat in mensa non referes vnquam
msItem.note: Walther, no. 7498, following the preceding without a break; also appears in Oxford, Trinity College MS 7, fol. 40. In the margin of fol. 1: (i) ‘apologia dicitur ab apo quod est res et logos sermo quasi de reali sermone’; (ii) ‘Murilegus consors in mensa sit tibi nunquam—Priuetur mensa qui spreuerit hec documenta’, five lines, perhaps the conclusion of (b).

msItem.incipit: Anno xlij. octouiani augusti natus est ihesus cristus filius dei in bethleem iude ex uirgine maria
msItem.explicit: anno domini xlo. scripsit matheus euangelium et anno xliijo edidit
msItem.note: Annals, mostly associated with the Nativity, including citations of CHRYSOSTOM and PAUL THE DEACON.

msItem.incipit: Legitur in annalibus libris Hebreorum apud Romanos existentibus quod Dominus Ihesus cristus qui dictus fuit a gentilibus
msItem.explicit: delectabiles erant Alloquio grauis rarus et modestus fuit
msItem.note: On Christ’s personal characteristics, followed, in the hand of (a) and (b), by instructions for a trental and a brief prayer. Fols. 4v–5 have the contents table for the volume, numbered to 35 items which match the numeration in the text rubrics and with four additional items at the end (added 3 + 1), introduced by the heading ‘Liber Fratris [erased] in quo continentur hec’.

msItem.incipit: Seint Sle commanda le Klemeyn par la Annuntiacion de angle que il fet
msItem.explicit: Penthecostis spiritus domini La setisime de la Assumpcion notre dame Gaudeamus
msItem.note: In anglicana, s. xiv med.

origin.origDate: s. xiii and s. xiv med.

msItem.rubric: Tradicio patrum in historiam de adam et de eius posteris i.
msItem.incipit: Legimus ex tradicione patrum de adam prothoplasto quod cum senuerat et
msItem.explicit: Et dicunt quidam quod hec tabella buxinea fuerat Ad honorem eius hanc tractaminus historiam qui nos redemit per crucem
msItem.note: Two theological notes follow the explicit, and the scribe adds on a leaf probably originally blank:

msItem.rubric: IOHANNES CRIOSTOMUS super euangelia Super cathedram moisi feria iija. ebdomade iio. xle.
msItem.incipit: Sunt plurimi sacerdotes qui omnem iusticiam populo mandant et ipsi non modicum seruant
msItem.explicit: descriptor tributi in ciuitate qui pauperes ledit et honorat potentes
msItem.author: PSEUDO-JOHN CHRYSOSTOM
msItem.title: ? Opus imperfectum
msItem.note: hom. 43 on Mt. 23, ed. PG 56:876?; followed by a note on St Martin.

msItem.rubric: [in a different contemporary hand: Natiuitas cristi] De natiuitate cristi 2.
msItem.incipit: Natiuitas domini nostri ihesu cristi secundum carnem ut quidam aiunt completis ab adam quinque milibus
msItem.explicit: dissimilis quia de spiritu sancto ex maria uirgne natus est
msItem.author: JACOBUS DE VORAGINE
msItem.title: Legenda aurea
msItem.note: ch. 6, ed. Th. Graesse (1890; Osnabrück, 1965), 40–7. Added below is a series of seven sets of verses, mostly distichs, including ‘Quoque caro fenum Flos feni gloria carnis | hec nichil est ’ (not in Walther). In the main, the remainder of the volume comprises similar excerpts from Jacobus, for which only summary identifications are provided:

msItem.incipit: De circumsisione domini 3
msItem.author: JACOBUS DE VORAGINE
msItem.title: Legenda aurea
msItem.note: ch. 13, ed. Graesse, 79–87.

msItem.incipit: De epiphania domini | [fol. 20] Epiphania 4.
msItem.author: JACOBUS DE VORAGINE
msItem.title: Legenda aurea
msItem.note: ch. 14, ed. Graesse, 87–94.

msItem.incipit: De purificacione beate virginis. | [fol. 24] De purificacione 5
msItem.author: JACOBUS DE VORAGINE
msItem.title: Legenda aurea

note.p: ch. 37, ed. Graesse, 158–66. Followed by an added paragraph (iii the scribal hand), with Jacobus’s conclusion (166–7) ‘Quedam alia matrona dum esset grauida—purificacionis prenottauit et integram sanitatem recepit’.
A new scribe begins writing at this point.

msItem.incipit: De passione Cristi 6.
msItem.author: JACOBUS DE VORAGINE
msItem.title: Legenda aurea
msItem.note: ch. 53, ed. Graesse, 223–35.

msItem.incipit: De resurreccione domini nostri ihesu cristi 7.
msItem.author: JACOBUS DE VORAGINE
msItem.title: Legenda aurea
msItem.note: ch. 54, ed. Graesse, 235–42

msItem.incipit: De letaniis 8.
msItem.author: JACOBUS DE VORAGINE
msItem.title: Legenda aurea
msItem.note: ch. 70, ed. Graesse, 312–14. The lower half of fol. 36v is blank.

msItem.incipit: De Iuda Scariothis 9.
msItem.author: JACOBUS DE VORAGINE
msItem.title: Legenda aurea
msItem.note: from ch. 45 (Mathias), ed. Graesse, 184–6.

msItem.incipit: De ascencione domini 10.
msItem.author: JACOBUS DE VORAGINE
msItem.title: Legenda aurea
msItem.note: ch. 72, ed. Graesse, 318–27. The last page has been filled in by another hand, and a few lines left blank at the foot.

msItem.incipit: De Inuencione sancte crucis 11.
msItem.author: JACOBUS DE VORAGINE
msItem.title: Legenda aurea
msItem.note: ch. 68, ed. Graesse, 303–11; a new hand, writing textura semiquadrata with anglicana g.

msItem.incipit: Iacobus minor 12.
msItem.author: JACOBUS DE VORAGINE
msItem.title: Legenda aurea
msItem.note: ch. 67, ed. Graesse, 295–303.

msItem.incipit: Commendatio fidelium 13.
msItem.author: JACOBUS DE VORAGINE
msItem.title: Legenda aurea
msItem.note: ch. 163, ed. Graesse, 728–39.

msItem.incipit: De sancto patricio 14.
msItem.author: JACOBUS DE VORAGINE
msItem.title: Legenda aurea
msItem.note: ch. 50, ed. Graesse, 213–16.

msItem.incipit: Quatuor coronatorum 15.
msItem.author: JACOBUS DE VORAGINE
msItem.title: Legenda aurea
msItem.note: ch. 164, ed. Graesse, 739–40.

msItem.incipit: De sancto Martino 16.
msItem.author: JACOBUS DE VORAGINE
msItem.title: Legenda aurea
msItem.note: ch. 166, ed. Graesse, 741–50.

msItem.incipit: De nomine sancti Clementis 17.
msItem.author: JACOBUS DE VORAGINE
msItem.title: Legenda aurea
msItem.note: ch. 170, ed. Graesse, 777–8.

msItem.incipit: Iohannes elemonis id est elemosinarius 18.
msItem.author: JACOBUS DE VORAGINE
msItem.title: Legenda aurea

note.p: A new scribe begins writing at this point.

msItem.incipit: De assupcione assumpcione beate Marie virginis 19.
msItem.author: JACOBUS DE VORAGINE
msItem.title: Legenda aurea
msItem.note: ch. 119, ed. Graesse, 504–16.

msItem.incipit: Exaltacio sancte crucis 20.
msItem.author: JACOBUS DE VORAGINE
msItem.title: Legenda aurea
msItem.note: ch. 137, ed. Graesse, 605–9.

msItem.incipit: De sancto Michaele
msItem.author: JACOBUS DE VORAGINE
msItem.title: Legenda aurea

note.p: ch. 145, ed. Graesse, 642–9. After the initial etymology the body of the legend in what is probably a new hand, beginning on lower fol. 82v. About five lines left blank at the foot of the last page.
A new scribe begins writing at this point.

msItem.incipit: De Iuliano episcopo 22.
msItem.author: JACOBUS DE VORAGINE
msItem.title: Legenda aurea
msItem.note: ch. 30, the introduction and 4–5 only, ed. Graesse, 140, 142–5.

msItem.incipit: aduentus De aduentu domini 23.
msItem.author: JACOBUS DE VORAGINE
msItem.title: Legenda aurea
msItem.note: ch. 1, ed. Graesse, 3–12. A leaf has been cancelled after fol. 89, with no text loss.

msItem.incipit: De septuagesima sexagesima quinquagesima et xla. 24.
msItem.author: JACOBUS DE VORAGINE
msItem.title: Legenda aurea
msItem.note: chs. 31–4, ed. Graesse, 146–53. Two or three lines have been left blank at the foot of the last page.

msItem.incipit: ‘De spiritu sancto 25.’
msItem.author: JACOBUS DE VORAGINE
msItem.title: Legenda aurea
msItem.note: ch. 73, ed. Graesse, 327–37.

msItem.rubric: [Fol. 121v] Tractatus fratris THOME DE AQUINO de ordine predicatorum de articulis fidei et aliis 26.
msItem.incipit: Ad instruccionem iuniorum quibus non vacat opusculorum variorum prolixitatem perscrutari
msItem.explicit: [Fol. 139v] consignacio ex crismate Res tantum gracia spiritus sancti Sacramentum et res caract’
msItem.rubric: [Fol. 101] De corpore cristi seu de eucaristia 26.
msItem.incipit: Incipit tractatus de corpore cristi seu de eucaristia ubi tangendum est tempus institucionis eius Hoc autem sacramentum ut plures uolunt in die cene plene institutum fuit
msItem.explicit: [fol. 120] minus tamen quam creator quia si eque uel magis tunc foret mortale [fol. 121v] ordo in quo agitur de generacione spirituali matrimonium in quo agitur de carnali

note.p: In fact SIMON HINTON OP, Brevis expositio articulorum fidei or Summa iuniorum (Sharpe, no. 1637 [614–16]), unpublished, but described in A. Dondaine, ‘Le Somme de Simon de Hinton’, Recherches de théologie ancienne et médiévale 9 (1937), 5–22, 205–18. The prose succeeded, after the explicit cited from fol. 120, by a septenary table and a distinctio of the sacraments.
The first ten lines on fol. 101 are written in a hand unparalleled elsewhere, the remainder in another new hand.

The text corresponds, with substantial paraphrase, to the copy of Hinton in BodL, MS Laud misc. 397, fols. 106–52rb, but with the text broken into two parts (at a point corresponding to Laud, fol. 131va) and the order of the two parts reversed. A hand of s. xv has added at the foot of fol. 139v the incipit of the eucharistic tract, which precedes in the MS, to indicate that it should in fact follow here. The number ‘26’ is assigned to the eucharistic portion only in the contents table, but the rubricator has numbered both parts ‘26’ in the rubrics and running titles. Fols. 140–3 were probably originally blank (perhaps for a conclusion?), now with added texts at the end of a booklet:

msItem.note: theological notes, distinctiones, prayers .

msItem.incipit: Iacobus iste apostolus dictus est iacobus zebedei
msItem.author: JACOBUS DE VORAGINE
msItem.title: Legenda aurea
msItem.note: ch. 99, through 5 only, ed. Graesse, 421–7. Written in gothic textura rotunda, s. xv.

msItem.incipit: Martha hospita cristi siro patre
msItem.author: JACOBUS DE VORAGINE
msItem.title: Legenda aurea
msItem.note: ch. 105, ed. Graesse, 444–7 (condensed).

msItem.incipit: Uir loquitur mulierque simul sic uerba serendo | Vir prior aggreditur
msItem.explicit: dominoque suo michi serint | Indomitata mallet femina sola michi
msItem.note: Walther, no. 20409; for discussions see Peter Dronke, Medieval Latin and the Rise of the European Love Lyric, 2nd edn. (Oxford, 1968), 2:571; Paul Gerhardt Schmidt, ‘Der Rangstreit zwischen Mann und Frau im lateinischen Mittelalter’, in G. J. Reinink and H. L. J. Vanstiphout (eds.), Dispute Poems and Dialogues in the Ancient and Medieval Near East (Louvain, 1991), 213–36, with a text; H. Walther, Das Streitgedicht in der lateinischen Literatur des Mittelalters (Munich, 1920), 137–9.

msItem.rubric: Si interrogates fueris vnde factus sit horno respondendum est 28.
msItem.incipit: Homo factus est de limo terre De aquis sole vento Nubibus lapidibus
msItem.explicit: amabilis et adquisitor regionis Si de spiritu sancto erit preclarus et electus
msItem.note: Unidentified.

msItem.incipit: Anticristus dicitur quia cristo contrarius erit cristus uenit humilis ilie ueniet superbus
msItem.explicit: [fol. 152v] qui ea hora seculum iudicabit qua ante secula iudicandum esse prefixit
msItem.rubric: De xv. signis quindecim dierum ante diem iudicii que IERONIMUS inuenit in annalibus hebreorum signum prime diei
msItem.incipit: Maria omnia in altitudinem exaltabuntur
msItem.explicit: Vniuersi homines morientur ut resurgant cum mortuis longe ante defunctis
msItem.author: ADSO DERVENSIS
msItem.title: ‘Libellus de anticristo’
msItem.note: in the excerpted version ed. PL 40:1131–4; joined with PETER DAMIAN, opusculum 59.4 ‘De novissimis et anticristo’, ed. PL 145:840–2. The contents table gives this section the joint title ‘De anticristo et xv. signis’.

msItem.rubric: De matrona romana et miraculo de corpore cristi per sanctum GREGORIUM 30.
msItem.incipit: Matrona quedam beato Gregorio per staciones publicas missarum solemna celebranti
msItem.explicit: Rursum cum populo in oracione prostratus carnis frustum in panem transmutauit
msItem.note: Unidentified, but a version of the anecdote appears in Legenda aurea, ch. 46, ed. Graesse, 197–8. The text may be added filler on a blank folio.

msItem.incipit: Qvidam Abbas extitit non longe ab vrbe Roma ordinis cisterciensibus minime subiectus qui quandam exposicionem super vij. visiones Apocalipsis edidit
msItem.explicit: qui anticristus seuissime persecucioni et uesane tirannidi audcat uel possit rebellando resistere
msItem.note: An excerpt from RALPH OF COGGESHALL, Chronicon Anglicanum (Sharpe, no. 1238 [445–6]), ed. Joseph Stevenson, RS 66 (1875), 67–70, the last of the four added items at the end of the contents table. The text again appears added, in this case not rubricated by the person responsible for the rest.

msItem.incipit: XI. M. virginum
msItem.author: JACOBUS DE VORAGINE
msItem.title: Legenda aurea
msItem.note: ch. 158, ed. Graesse, 701–5. A very much later scribe, writing gothic textura semiquadrata, s. xv, is responsible for this item and the next, in a single-quire booklet apparently intruded later.

msItem.rubric: Incipit passio beate uirginis et martiris barbare
msItem.incipit: Regnante Maximiano imperatore et Martiano preside fuit quidam vir in nichomedia ciuitate
msItem.explicit: uirgo barbara sub Maximiano imperatore pridie nonas decembris regnante domino ihesu cristo in perpetuum amen
msItem.note: BHL no. 915, ed. Pio Paschini, ‘S. Barbara: note agiografiche’, Letteranum, 1927 at 38–50 (‘redazione B’).

msItem.rubric: Incipit liber sancti MARTINI de quatuor uirtutibus qui appellatur formula uite honeste 31.
msItem.incipit: Quatuor uirtutum species multorum sapientum sentenciis diffinite sunt quibus humanus animus comptus
msItem.explicit: aut ruentem compos ipse deuitet insaniam aut deficientem contepnat contempnat ignauiam
msItem.author: MARTIN OF BRAGA
msItem.title: Formula vitae honestae
msItem.note: (CPL 1080), without the prologue, ed. Claude W. Barlow, Martini… Opera omnia (New Haven, 1950), 237–50.

msItem.incipit: Multi multa sciunt et seipsos nesciunt Alios inspiciunt et seipsos deserunt Omni querunt
msItem.explicit: in quo sponsum cum sponsa perspicies vnum eundemque dominum glorie Qui uiuit [form ending]
msItem.author: PS.-BERNARD
msItem.title: Meditationes

msItem.rubric: Incipit liber sancti AUGUSTINI episcopi de conflictu viciorum atque virtutum 33.
msItem.incipit: Apostolica uox clamat per orbem atque in precinctu fidei positis
msItem.explicit: inanes efficiat Tu autem homo dei uigilanti studio attende ea que dixi
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit de conflictu viciorum et virtutum
msItem.author: PS.-AUGUSTINE
msItem.title: 'De conflictu viciorum atque virtutum'
msItem.note: breaking off in ch. 26, ed. PL 40:1091–1103. Ten text lines have been left blank at the foot of the last leaf.

msItem.rubric: Cur deus hominem post lapsum non dampnauit in perpetuum | [fol. 192v] 34
msItem.incipit: Diabolus uidens hominem ob hoc a deo esse factum ut illam gloriam haberet quam ipse per suam superbiam
msItem.explicit: ut mortem persequeretur in tartarum et exeptum morti hominem portaret in celum
msItem.note: Unidentified. Five verses follow the explicit at the page foot, inc. ‘Percuciens clericum romam petat excipiuntur ’, (Walther, no. 13976, who cites two other English copies).

msItem.incipit: De Ieiunio quatuor temporum 35.
msItem.author: JACOBUS DE VORAGINE
msItem.title: Legenda aurea
msItem.note: ch. 35, ed. Graesse, 153–4. In a new hand. About half the final page is blank, now with added verses:

msItem.incipit: Quid facient enses site levis aura cruentet
msItem.note: about ten sets of distichs (Walther, no. 15792); part of the text has been written vertically in the gutter), s. xiv in.

msItem.incipit: Cristoforus ante baptismum dicebatur reprobus
msItem.author: JACOBUS DE VORAGINE
msItem.title: Legenda aurea
msItem.note: ch. 100, ed. Graesse, 430–4. The first of the four items added to the contents table, without reference numbers, ‘De sancto cristoforo martire’.

msItem.incipit: Iohannes baptista multipliciter nominatur
msItem.author: JACOBUS DE VORAGINE
msItem.title: Legenda aurea
msItem.note: ch. 86, ed. Graesse, 356–64, added in the contents table as ‘De natiuitate sancti iohannis baptiste’.

msItem.incipit: Iohannes et paulus primicerii et prepositi
msItem.author: JACOBUS DE VORAGINE
msItem.title: Legenda aurea
msItem.note: ch. 8, ed. Graesse, 364–7. The third item added to the table; only five lines written on the last page, with a few pen-trials beneath.

supportDesc.collation: 110 [fol. 15, a booklet boundary] | 212 [fol. 27, a booklet boundary] | 3–412 512(–10, a stub after 3, fol. its conjugate) 612 [fol. 74, a booklet boundary] | 710 [fol. 84, a booklet boundary] | 812 (– 6, a stub following fol. 89) [fol. 95, a booklet boundary] | 9–1212 [to fol. 143, a booklet boundary] | 1312 (–12) [fol. 154, a booklet boundary] | 148 [fol. 162, a booklet boundary] | 1512 16–1710 [fol. 194, a booklet boundary] | 188 (–8, a stub, probably blank). Fols. 1–5 are extraneous front matter, and appear to be singletons pasted to stubs, although fols. 2 + 3 are a bifolium. The MS is generally homogeneous in finishing, with catchwords within booklets. All leaves in the first halves of most quires are signed, in various materials, with an arabic quire number and a letter; in this system quires 1–17 = 1–16 (quire 14, unusually, is unsigned and intruded later, at the conclusion of the material in the contents table). From quire 9 on, only the first leaf is signed with an arabic numeral, and the other signatures are roman; the first leaf signatures may be from a different system.

handDesc.handNote: Written in gothic textura semiquadrata (more than one hand). Punctuation usually by point; some scribes also use the punctus elevatus and/or virgula.

decoDesc.decoNote: Two-line alternate red and blue lombards on flourishing of the other colour at the heads of texts. Although many have been fully or partly cut away, the person who provided the capitals wrote counts of them by the quire on the foot of the last verso, e.g. ‘iiij littere’ (fol. 27v).
Texts handled variously within sections: divided by red-slashed capitals, red paraphs, etc.

Two sets of running titles (one for each opening); the first, red arabic numerals to identify texts with the contents table entries; the second set in ink, some added later in scribal hands, provide titles.
